sub_title: Digital Health Strategist/Public Health researcher/Digital transformation enabler/Digital Equity advocator/m-Health/Policy2Practice/Healthcare management/Regulatory science
summary:
I reimagine what it takes to have healthy individuals and populations in the Digital Era. 

I belive we invent technology and it invent us back. I want to explore both ways! 

#Digital transformation 
#System thinkers 
#Digtal Health strategy
#unleash value-based care 
#shift to integrated care
#Digital inclusion
#Patient/citizen-centred innovation
#Staycurious about people
#relationship builder
#Transformational leadership
#Intellectual humility # self-care. #Compassion. 


I am an interdisciplinary public health researcher with a strategist acumen. I work at the intersection between Digital Innovation, Global health, and ICT towards effective digital transformation.  I enjoy combining my contextual understanding of Europe and LMICs to address challenges in health care.  I am a technology enthusiast who also talks the language of business

I have an international working experience in the USA, UK, and Europe in different areas such as Regulatory Affairs, Pharmaceutical policies, Medical Device, Digital Health ecosystems, and management consulting. 

Trust, integrity, curiosity, audacity, genuine relationships, and value-driven contribution are my core life and work values, I strive to live by every day. I enjoy using cross-cutting expertise such as policy analysis, Public health advocacy, strategic thinking, health communication, project management, Qualitative research ( oh, I like humans and what make them strive in life ), global health diplomacy, and leadership skills to advocate for people-centred ethically grounded, and inclusive solutions to advance their health and well being and decrease inequalities. I also enjoy using my curiosity to work irretrievably on sophisticated projects and strategic partnerships. I enjoy solving complex business challenges by leveraging innovative ideas, people, processes, and technology.

While I am at ease to work on both strategic and operational sides, strategy, knowledge brokering between politics and Health policy worlds is what I do best. 

My life journey, places I lived in, people whom I met, strangers' stories about their health and life quality, and my personal experience as a patient have shaped my passion for public health. Health is personal for me and advocating for UHC is my moral obligation to honour and help people I care for. What is your story? Let's talk!

awards.title: Hubert Humphrey Fellowship
awards.description:
This Fellowship Program was initiated by President Jimmy Carter in 1979 .The Hubert H. Humphrey Fellowship Program provides ten months of non-degree academic study and professional enrichment in the United States for mid carriers experienced professionals from designated countries undergoing development or political transition.
The Humphrey Program is a Fulbright exchange activity. Its primary funding is provided by the U.S. Congress through the Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs of the U.S. Department of State. The Institute of International Education (IIE) assists the U.S. Department of State in administering the Humphrey Fellowship Program.
2014-2015 cohort consists of  173 fellows from 93 countries studying in 17 fields and campuses across USA .
awards.issuer: U.S Department of states - International Institute of Education

projects.title: Masters thesis Project 2019 " How to leverage digital technologies in Europe/ thinking health inequalities"
projects.description: In my Master's thesis project I interned with EPHA ( European Public Health Alliance) and I researched how to leverage digital technology to advance public health without increasing health inequalities. I conducted qualitative research with experts, policymakers in European institutions ( DG Sante and DG connect ) and stakeholders including NGOs, patient organisation and trade associations. The research concluded several recommendations for policymakers to be considered in the future.

contributors.headline: Digital Health Strategist/Public Health researcher/Digital transformation enabler/Digital Equity advocator/m-Health/Policy2Practice/Healthcare management/Regulatory science

profile_positions.description:
Come talk to me about:
1- Using maturity models to inform the digital transformation journeys of Healthcare globally, especially in Europe and the Middle East.
2- Shifting to value-based care,integrated care delivery, community care models and digital ecosystems 
3- Using IT to reimagine new healthcare services that make sense, away from the legacy ways of doing things. 
4- The use of Digital Health tools to empower patients.
5- The use of digital infrastructure and Data to tackle health inequality.
6- Digital health literacy and Digital inequality.
profile_positions.title: Digital Health Strategist

profile_positions.description: I help reimagine creating health for individuals and populations in the Digital Era through thought leadership across various expertise domains including Digital Health strategy, planning and implementing Digital health programs, new care models, product conception, data Governance, Innovation research, Digital Diplomacy, Digital Literacy and equity.
profile_positions.title: Digital Health Consultant

company.name: WHO Digital Health Technical Advisory Group at World Health Org

profile_positions.company: WHO Digital Health Technical Advisory Group at World Health Org
profile_positions.description:
As a roster member at WHO Digital Health Technical Advisory Group at World Health Org;
We provide support to WHO’s newly-established Digital Health Department. It will work to harness the power of digital health technologies. 

The advisory group shall have the following functions:

1- To provide high-level global strategic advice and support to the WHO Secretariat on the Organization’s digital health vision and strategy, thereby facilitating WHO’s positioning and comparative advantage in the subject to enable maximum impact; and
2- To review the digital health frontier landscape and advise the WHO Secretariat on possible effective new areas for intervention in that subject.
profile_positions.title: Roster member

profile_positions.description: As a short term consultant, I am providing technical support to the Be He@lthy Be Mobile team, in the newly established Digital Health department DHI/ WHO HQ. I provide technical assistance and project management to various initiatives, started with the EU m-Health hub project Now I am working mostly on the Digital Health Maturity model and health outcomes project besides other initiatives around telehealth. All these projects aim to operationalize the Global digital Health strategy and to catalyze the digital transformation of health care.
profile_positions.title: Digital Health consulant

profile_positions.description:
I joined EUPHA  to help establish the digital health chapter. Within those 4 months, I provided 3 draft written products, still to be published: 

1- A position paper titled "Harnessing the digital revolution for Healthy populations in Europe ".
2- Draft of the Advocacy plan for digital health activities within EUPHA.
3- Draft to a joined statement about digitalization in Europe between EUPHA and EPHA
profile_positions.title: Digital Health Policy Officer

profile_positions.description:
I am the faculty's official student ambassador for the Maastricht University's master's programme in Governance and Leadership in European Public Health. 
I provide information and respond to  questions about the programme and about (student) life in Maastricht; I am happy to help you with your study choice, as previous student ambassadors helped me.
Mariam posts weekly on Facebook and Instagram about her experiences during the master's programme and her life in Maastricht. She's happy to answer your questions about the programme and about (student) life in Maastricht.
profile_positions.title: Master's ambassador/ challenger " Governance and Leadership in European Public Health " program

profile_positions.description:
-Provide a high level of analysis of digital policy developments, both in the EU and wider developments that will impact on the EU
-Carrying out daily monitoring and research on policy developments within the European Union about "Digital health and innovation" 
-Draft policy briefs, position papers and other communications material;
-Attend Policy debates and meetings in Brussels,  participating as policy officer,  helping to organise and attend events, etc. 
-Support the work of our policy team in the following areas:

Agriculture policy (Food, Alcohol & Tobacco) and NCDs
EU Semester for Health (Macroeconomic governance and Macroeconomic Policy)
Healthy Trade policy
Public Health in the EU Budget and Programmes, Building and presenting the evidence-base for policy-making
Fair Access to Medicines
Action on Antimicrobial Resistance (AMR)
Inclusive E-/M-Health
Health Systems Performance Assessment (HSPA)
Health inequalities: Roma health
profile_positions.title: Health Policy Analyst/intern

profile_positions.description:
-Provide technical assistance relating to Pharmaceutical Policies and Medicine Access to INGOs.
-Provide technical Support to ongoing research in INGOs, Survey structure, Research methodology and Execution.eg: Population Council Egypt promoting Sexual& Reproductive Health.
-Business development to Health start ups.
profile_positions.title: Consultant: INGOs, Public Health Projects eg : Population Council, IMS ( IQVIA Now)

profile_positions.description:
-Developing research proposals, building questionnaires and discussion guides.
-Plan Operations and reach out activities to community members.
-Supporting data analysis by collating the responses to the questionnaires.
-Providing administrative support to the project as well as undertaking other tasks if necessary
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description: Through my internship in RAPS ,I worked mainly on the project of a global Regulatory curriculum in low and middle income countries . which involve developing an approach for integrating regulatory evaluation tools , and will recommend strategies for expanding and sustaining training for Regulatory professional in low and middle income countries . Besides I am getting involved in many initiatives of projects between FDA and WHO relating regulatory affairs and health system strengthening. Besides I will get hands in field with FDA policies for new guidelines for medical devices and combined products Reviews . I got exposed to the experience of PAHO in early adopting this strategy in assessing their Regulatory capacity in south America . IT was a wonderful learning experience and extreme boost to my professionalism and working in Multilateral international Projects  .
profile_positions.title: Project Intern

volunteer_experiences.description:
*Plan and organise health and sexual awareness to students and their parents.
*Provide counselling service to students, part time teaching. 
*Coordinate and help organising Fund raising events and community outreach.

Health 2.0 Cairo is the official local chapter for the global Health 2.0.
Our current focus is to document the activity of innovators like you, and the idea is to take 
a 'snapshot' of the state of healthcare innovation companies in Cairo. We aim to generate a quantitative and qualitative report on different aspects e.g funding, growth,obstacles, product areas, needs, etc...
The purpose of this research is to identify and tackle the common obstacles facing Entrepreneurs in health innovation , m-health and finding ways to empower them to increase their products intake, adoption and scaling up.
